words.ENTRY: <H>year</H><audio>year.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><NR>1.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>the period from January 1 to December 31; 365 or 366 days divided into 12 months or 52 weeks:</D> <X>last year/this year/next year</X><dot><X>The population of the country will be 70 million by the year 2020.</X><dot><X>We go on vacation at this time every year.</X><NR>2.</NR><bracket>countable</bracket><D>any period of 12 months, measured from any point:</D> <X>She worked here for 20 years.</X><dot><X>He quit school just over a year ago.</X><dot><X>They've been living in New Jersey for the last few years.</X>

yesinterjection1.(used when answering a question to which another possible answer is "no"): "Are you having a good time?" "Yes, I am!"I asked him if he wanted to come, and he said yes.2.(used for saying that a statement is correct or for agreeing with one): "You spend too much money." "Yes, you're right."3.(used when agreeing to a request): "May I sit here?" "Yes, of course."4.(used when accepting an offer): "More coffee?" "Yes, please."5.(used for showing you have heard sb or will do what he/she asks): "Waiter!" "Yes, ma'am."6.(informal) (used to express great pleasure or satisfaction): Yes! Jordan scored the winning basket!

<H>yesterday</H><audio>yesterday.mp3</audio><PS>adverb;</PS> <PS>noun</PS><bracket>countable, uncountable</bracket><D>(on) the day before today:</D> <X>Did you watch that show on TV yesterday?</X><dot><X>yesterday morning/afternoon/evening</X><dot><X>Do you still have yesterday's newspaper?</X>
<H>yoga</H><audio>yoga.mp3</audio><PS>noun</PS><bracket>uncountable</bracket><D>a system of exercises that helps you control and relax both your mind and your body</D>

<H>you</H><audio>you.mp3</audio><PS>pronoun</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>the person or people being spoken or written to:</D> <X>You can play the guitar, can't you?</X><dot><X>Bring your bag with you.</X><NR>2.</NR><D>a person (not a particular one); people in general:</D> <X>You don't see many tourists here at this time of year.</X><dot><X>The more you earn, the more taxes you pay.</X>

<H>your</H><audio>your.mp3</audio><PS>determiner</PS><NR>1.</NR><D>belonging to or connected with the person or people being spoken to:</D> <X>What's your apartment like?</X><dot><X>Thanks for all your help.</X><dot><X>How old are your kids now?</X><NR>2.</NR><D>belonging to or connected with people in general:</D> <X>When your life is as busy as mine, you don't have much time to relax.</X>
yours (strong form) pronounbelonging to or connected with you: Is this bag yours or mine?I was talking to a friend of yours the other day.

yourselfpronoun(plural yourselves) (used as the object of a verb or preposition when you are speaking to somebody and talking about this person/these people doing an action and also being affected by it): Be careful or you'll hurt yourself.Here's some money. Buy yourselves a present.You're always talking about yourself! by yourself/yourselves alone: Do you live by yourself?
